ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You will participate in a series of discussions on aspects of conduct in academic physics, including proper research ethics, proper reporting and maintenance of data, and how to avoid discrimination and harassment in scientific settings. The discussions are very informative if you pay attention and participate, and the time commitment is quite low.
It is definitely recommended. If one's not sure about what kind of research one would like to conduct, it's good to make use of this chance to explore ahead of choosing actual advisor.
It's a necessary course, so you might as well try to make the best out of it

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Teaches you important things to look out for / be aware of as you go on to do dissertation research.
